objects.name: Analytic 0691
objects.description: CONTAINERS (Docker/K8s/containerd): A user pulls an untrusted image from a public/unknown registry and then creates/starts a container from that image. Shortly after start, the container spawns unexpected utilities (e.g., curl/wget/bash/python), or makes outbound network connections atypical for the namespace/workload. The analytic correlates Image Creation/Download → Container Creation → Container Start → Command Execution/Network activity within a short window and with a consistent image digest.

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: containerd:events
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: Image pull from untrusted registry (name NOT IN allowlist) or new digest never seen before

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: kubernetes:audit
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: create: Pod/Container created with image tag 'latest' or mutable tag; imagePullPolicy=Always; noDigest=true

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: kubernetes:events
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: start: ContainerStarted or Pulling image → Started container

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: auditd:SYSCALL
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: execve: Process in container namespace executes curl|wget|bash|sh|python|nc with outbound args

x_mitre_log_source_references.name: NSM:Flow
x_mitre_log_source_references.channel: New egress from container IP/namespace to Internet or non-approved CIDRs/ASNs

x_mitre_mutable_elements.description: Correlation window from image pull to container activity (e.g., ≤15m).
Executables treated as high-risk when run in app containers (bash, sh, curl, wget, nc, powershell for Windows containers).
K8s namespaces that should never pull from Internet or run mutable tags.
Destination networks/domains that should not be contacted by containers.
